page.title: 11ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: In this area there is not much commercial entertainment. There is one cinema, no theatres and no night clubs. There are several private clubs which do have live entertainment, such as pop groups , comedians and musicians. Besides these there are lots of amateur societies giving performances in church halls and community centres. The Tithebarn at Melling is such a centre and is aided by the Arts Council, som many atalented artists of repute are able to bring the theatre and concert hall tothe district. There are many public houses in the area in a variety of styles from the ancient sandstone of Bootle Arms to ultra modern Alt Park Hotel. There are two or three small restaurants. Most local people rely on Liverpool or Southport for entertainment.
